result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Crystel M. Mangert

DEJ Order

1:16 PM ADA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Crystel M. Mangert in court.  Attorney Stephen Donald Willett in court for Crystel M. Mangert.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states there has not been a preliminary hearing in this matter as of yet. ADA Fuhr states Victim's Rights Legislations have been complied with. Attorney Willett goes over the waiver of preliminary hearing form with his client. ADA Fuhr states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 1 the State will move to Dismiss and Read in Ct. 2. So ordered. Attorney Willett presents the court with the Waiver form. Court goes over the signed waiver of preliminary hearing form with the defendant. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Court questions Attorney Willett on Arraignment or proceeding with Plea and Sentencing. Attorney Willett states they will move to Plea and Sentencing. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 therefore Ct. 2 is DISMISSED and READ IN. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders a Deferred Entry of Judgement on Ct. 1 for 2 Years.
DEJ Order
Unsigned Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Unsigned Plea Questionnaire
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
